content:
Diagnosis:	Atypical carcinoid tumor of right middle lobe bronchus

Management:	15 Mar 2024 Bronchoscopic biopsy
		28 Mar 2024 Right middle lobectomy with systematic nodal dissection

Histology:	Atypical carcinoid tumor, 1.8cm, Ki67 8%, SSTR2/5 positive, 2 mitoses per 2mm2, focal necrosis present
		pT1bN0M0 (AJCC 8th edition)
		R0 resection with clear margins

Current Situation:	Post-operative follow-up

I reviewed [redacted name] today following her recent right middle lobectomy for an atypical carcinoid tumor. She has made an excellent recovery from surgery with minimal post-operative pain, now well controlled on regular paracetamol alone. Her chest drain was removed on day 3 post-operation and she was discharged on day 5 with no complications.

On examination today, her wound has healed well with no signs of infection. Her chest is clear with good air entry bilaterally. Performance status remains 0.

I have discussed the histology results which confirm a completely resected atypical carcinoid tumor. Given the favorable pathological features and absence of nodal involvement, no adjuvant therapy is indicated. We have arranged baseline CT chest/abdomen/pelvis and chromogranin A/5HIAA measurements as part of her surveillance protocol.

The plan is to see her again in 3 months with scan results. I have provided information about symptoms to watch for and contact details for the specialist nurse team.
